metadata.title: Piaggio P.180 Avanti
aws::graph::propositions: Piaggio P.180 Avanti Government Commitments and Business Status
The Italian government committed to €716 million in orders for Piaggio Aerospace on 21 June 2019.
The Italian government aimed to make Piaggio Aerospace more attractive to a potential buyer.
The Italian defence ministry committed €260 million for nine new Avanti Evos.
The Italian defence ministry committed to upgrading 19 earlier Piaggio aircraft.
The Italian government committed €200 million for engine maintenance.
The Italian government committed €160 million for P1HH HammerHead certification completion.
The Italian government committed to acquiring at least one P1HH HammerHead system.
One P1HH HammerHead system consists of two aircraft and one ground station.
The Italian government committed €96 million for logistics support.
The deals were pending approval as of June 2019.
Two Piaggio aircraft had been delivered in 2019 prior to June 21.
Two more Piaggio aircraft remained in the backlog as of June 2019.
Three non-binding expressions of interest to buy the Piaggio aircraft business had been received.
Ten non-binding expressions of interest for the Piaggio engine business had been received.
Twenty-six non-binding expressions of interest for the whole Piaggio company had been received.
The official tender for the sale of Piaggio Aerospace was to start after summer 2019.
The Piaggio P.180 Avanti fleet surpassed one million flight hours by December 2020.

text:
On 21 June 2019, the Italian government committed to €716 million in orders to make the business more attractive to a potential buyer: €260 million from the defence ministry for nine new Avanti Evos, plus an upgrade of 19 earlier aircraft; €200 million for engine maintenance; €160 million for the P1HH HammerHead certification completion and at least one system (two aircraft and one ground station) acquisition; and €96 million for logistics support. While the deals should be approved later, two aircraft had been delivered so far in 2019, and two more remain in the backlog.
Three non-binding expressions of interest to buy the aircraft business had been received, 10 for the engine business and 26 for the whole company. The official tender for the sale of Piaggio Aerospace was to start after the summer of 2019.
By December 2020, the fleet surpassed one million flight hours.
